page.title: 02Castle Kennedy Gardens
page.content: The Gardens are owned by Lord Stair and are open to the public. The main features are the rhododendrons and the monkey puzzle avenue which is about 100 years old.The view over the Black Loch shows Inch Crindle which is a small man-made island with crannog remains.The Giant's Grave is a big mound. The present Earl of Stair told us that when the 2cnd. Earl was a Field Marshall he and his soldiers used the Giant's Grave for fighting. There is a beautiful circular lily pond covering 2 acres. There is also a sunken garden and a large walled garden.The gardens are open daily. They usually have between 4000-5000 visitors annually but some years have many more. There is a well-stocked garden centre and a small shop and cafe.
